messages.content: comfyui-replicate is a custom node for running Replicate models in ComfyUI.
Where can I find example workflows for comfyui-replicate?
You can find example workflows for comfyui-replicate in the 'example_workflows' directory of the GitHub repository.
How do I set my Replicate API token before running comfyui-replicate?

You need to set your REPLICATE_API_TOKEN in your environment before running comfyui-replicate. You can do this by exporting the token on MacOS or Linux using 'export REPLICATE_API_TOKEN="your_token"; python main.py' or setting the token on Windows using 'set REPLICATE_API_TOKEN="your_token"; python main.py'.
How can I install comfyui-replicate directly?

To install comfyui-replicate directly, you need to navigate to the 'ComfyUI/custom-nodes' directory, clone the GitHub repository using 'git clone https://github.com/replicate/comfyui-replicate', change to the 'comfyui-replicate' directory, and then install the requirements using 'pip install -r requirements.txt'.
Where can I find the supported Replicate models for comfyui-replicate?
You can find the supported Replicate models for comfyui-replicate in the 'supported_models.json' file.
How can I update the Replicate models in comfyui-replicate?
To update the Replicate models in comfyui-replicate, simply run './import_schemas.py' which will update all model nodes. The latest version of a model is used by default.
How can I add more models to comfyui-replicate?

To add more models to comfyui-replicate, you can add the model to 'supported_models.json', run './import_schemas.py' to update all schemas and import your new model, restart ComfyUI, and then use the model in your workflow. The model will have the title 'Replicate [model author/model name]'.
What types of models are currently supported by comfyui-replicate?
Currently, comfyui-replicate supports models that return simple text or image outputs. Models that return audio, video, JSON objects or a combination of outputs are not supported.
